documentType: grand jury subpoena and credit report
summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Experian, dated August 16, 2019, demanding credit information for Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes the subpoena, a rider specifying the request, a custodian declaration, and Maxwell's Experian credit profile from August 27, 2019. The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into violations including sex trafficking.

persons.name: Rick V. Haas
persons.context: He is the custodian of records who signed the declaration certifying the authenticity of the credit records provided in response to the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the U.S. Attorney who signed the grand jury subpoena demanding records from Experian as part of a federal criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Subject of the grand jury subpoena
persons.context: She is the individual whose credit reports, fraud alerts, and related documents are being subpoenaed by the grand jury. Her credit profile is attached, showing her addresses and financial accounts.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is leading the grand jury investigation for which Maxwell's financial records are being subpoenaed.
Haas, as Experian's custodian, certified and produced Maxwell's credit records in response to the grand jury subpoena targeting her.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance for Experian
events.description: The subpoena commands Experian to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a grand jury subpoena to Experian for Ghislaine Maxwell's credit information as part of an investigation into federal criminal violations including sex trafficking.

events.title: Credit Profile Generated
events.description: Experian generates and provides Ghislaine Maxwell's credit profile in response to the grand jury subpoena, detailing her addresses, social security number, and financial accounts.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Experian on August 16, 2019, for all credit reports and related documents on Ghislaine Maxwell as part of an investigation into violations including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking) and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The subpoena includes a non-disclosure request, indicating the investigation was ongoing and confidential at the time.

The responsive document includes Maxwell's Experian credit profile from August 27, 2019, listing her addresses in Boston, MA, New York, NY, and Teaneck, NJ, along with details of her financial accounts.
The credit report shows Maxwell had accounts with major financial institutions including American Express, Bank of America, UBS, JPMorgan Chase, and Capital One/Saks.
